Waking up next to Charlie Spring was a delectable experience â€” that much Nick had become well acquainted with. Even more so, waking up next to Charlie Spring after finally getting to kiss him? That was an entirely incomparable acquaintance. It was like that scene in Ratatouille, when Remi has sampled the cheese and the strawberry separately and feels that heâ€™s in heaven; but then he experiences the two of them together at once and is taken away to another, entirely unprecedented planet altogether.

It was almost achingly saccharine when Nickâ€™s eyes fluttered open on their own accord Saturday morning, with no necessity for an alarm clock to rip him from one of the best sleeps of his life. His body just knew, without having to be told, that he wasnâ€™t going to want to miss this, that he would want a moment alone to soak it all in during his favourite time of day. The sun was just scarcely breaching the horizon, smudging it that pale, dusty yellow that blends so naturally with the cool, blue-grey of January on the coast of England.

A mere shard of light was lurking through the narrow crack of space left open between Charlieâ€™s black out curtains, and when mixed with the soft, rotating colours of their diffuser-night light combo, it was enough lustre for Nick to be able to admire Charlie to his heart's content. This wasnâ€™t a new experience, awakening with Charlie lying across his body, cheeks pink from sleep and plush lips faintly parted from the pressure of their face squished against Nickâ€™s chest. What would be new was that when Charlie woke from their idle slumber, adorably groggy, and beautifully, beautifully near, Nick would be allowed to lean down and capture their nectarous lips in a kiss â€” because he could do that now.

Every time Nick closed his eyes, he could recall their first kiss with perfect clarity. It was as fresh as a photograph from an old film camera coming to life in a dark room. The memory of Charlie climbing onto his lap was so clear that Nick could almost assume heâ€™d written the moment himself.

Nick toyed with that thought for some time while he watched Charlieâ€™s back rise and fall with every deep, comatose breath that ended with an endearing whistle of air puffing through his pink lips. With the way Charlieâ€™s head was angled, every billow of air danced over Nickâ€™s collarbone and tickled down to the spew of auburn hairs at the top of his chest. The same hairs that the pads of Charlieâ€™s fingers were resting on with the partially unfurled fist docked right over Nickâ€™s heart. It was a simple syrup of circumstances, nothing but a basic touch and the heat of their feelings combining to make this a morning out of Nickâ€™s most sought after dreams.

Nickâ€™s eyes traced the cutting curve of Charlieâ€™s cheek, the full arch of his brows, and the way his lashes fanned out against his skin. The soft, multicoloured light of the diffuser painted Charlieâ€™s features in hues of lavender, teal, and rose, making him appear almost ethereal â€” not much unlike his typical state in Nickâ€™s eyes.

At some point the sun had crossed the border of the horizon and fully disclosed itself to the morning sky. Around that same time, a hungered vibration stirred in Nickâ€™s stomach that was sure to wake Charlie if Nick didnâ€™t get to them first. He lifted his arm that wasnâ€™t buried by the weight of Charlie and slid his hands through Charlie silken curls with deft fingers, cupping the back of their head while leaning down to press a tender kiss to their forehead. His lips hardly met skin, mostly the free-spirited locks of hair that commanded presence wherever Charlie went. There was the faintest hitch in Charlieâ€™s breath before they crawled even closer to Nick, shifting until they were almost entirely planked on top of him. Nick couldnâ€™t help but giggle; though theyâ€™d only woken up together a handful of times now, Nick knew better than to expect an immediate stirring from Charlie. The weight was as comforting as the body of another human could be, every point of contact brought with it a sweet, intimate air of peace that whisked Nick away to his own personal cloud nine.

â€œChar,â€ Nick whispered. He stroked his hand up and down through Charlieâ€™s hair, scratching his scalp lightly with every downward pass.

Charlie groaned in response. It wasnâ€™t petulant, moreso an adorable reluctance that let Nick know it was safe to continue â€” carefully â€” despite any protests.

â€œChar, Iâ€™ve got to wake up or my stomach is going to blow, itâ€™s beginning to sound like a volcano.â€ Nick kept his voice quiet and steady, wanting to ease Charlie into consciousness as best he could. In reality, Nick knew that he would stay like this forever. He would allow himself to waste away in this moment if it meant spending his last ticks of his clock under the soothing weight of Charlie, listening and feeling the steady thump of his heartbeat. Even with their chests pressed so firmly together, Nick could feel the tug of the invisible string linking their hearts. He traced the contours of Charlieâ€™s body with his fingertips and watched as the string danced subtle movements in time with every motion like he was controlling a marionette.

â€œBut â€™m cozy,â€ Charlie garbled. He lifted his head just barely to reposition it into the junction of Nickâ€™s neck.

Nick smiled at the feeling, holding Charlieâ€™s head still and revelling in the tickle of their lips brushing against the border of his auburn stubble under his jaw. Charlie must have sensed how pleased Nick was by the subtle movement, because in the next moment, he began to move his lips more intentionally. He kissed down the side of Nickâ€™s neck to his shoulder and back again before settling on a space with coordinates marked between Nickâ€™s throat and the corner of his jaw. When Charlieâ€™s lips parted narrowly on their next move, Nickâ€™s fingers contracted reflexively and resulted in a faint tug of the hair gripped between his fingers. Charlie hummed pleasantly and pulled back, eyes hooded with a melange of sleep and pining.

â€œYouâ€™ve got my attention,â€ Charlie muttered before leaning in and catching Nickâ€™s lips. The kiss was slower and felt far more intentional than the night before, like they were taking the time to learn one another in a way that felt inconsequential last night. Charlie kissed Nick with a purpose and rigour that Nick savoured almost desperately. Nick was already addicted to the taste of Charlieâ€™s lips â€” from the perfect, velvet bow of their top lip to their incredibly soft and full bottom lip. Charlieâ€™s hand ran up and over Nickâ€™s chest, slipping behind his neck to pull him deeper into the kiss, a not so subtle demand for more. Their bodies pressed flush together under the light weight of Charlieâ€™s linen duvet that had pooled down at their waists. Somewhere along the line, Nick had entirely forgotten that he had been hungry and that his goal in waking Charlie up had been to acquire breakfast. Now, another taste of Charlie was all that he craved. Nick wrapped his lips around Charlieâ€™s like he was pulling the juice from the core of a peach, savouring every drop of sweetness extracted how one would delight in their final meal.

The kiss was slow and indulgent, packed with a devotedness that kept Nickâ€™s heart pounding at a perilous pace. When the two finally pulled apart, their foreheads pressed together as their breath hung mingled in the space between their mouths. Nickâ€™s eyes were half mast and a dazed smile fabricated on his kiss-swollen lips as he dropped his head back onto a feather pillow with a merry sigh. Charlie rolled off of Nick and onto his back, groaning contentedly as he stretched out his aching muscles still stiff with slumber.

Nick glanced over at Charlie, his heart swelling with affection just at the sight of him. The way his chest rose and fell with each breath, faintly laboured from the exertion of their kiss; the way his red and kiss-bitten lips pulled up in a gratified smile. It was all so perfect.

â€œPerhaps mornings arenâ€™t so terrible after all,â€ Charlie sang, turning back towards Nick while their fingers ghosted over the sliver of skin in between Nickâ€™s sweats and the lifted hem of his vest.

â€œIâ€™ve tried to tell you as much,â€ Nick teased. He twisted over onto his side to face Charlie and nearly jumped out of his skin when the action caused Charlieâ€™s hand to slip fully under his top and land on Nickâ€™s bare waist. His hand was cool but the touch seared Nickâ€™s skin. Nickâ€™s breath hitched, his eyes widening at the unexpected contact and his expression a mix of surprise and delight.

Charlieâ€™s lips twisted into a vexatious smile. â€œYou alright there?â€ They asked as they slowly moved their hand, fingers skating indiscernible patterns on Nickâ€™s skin.

â€œYeah, justâ€¦ yeah,â€ Nick admitted breathlessly as Charlieâ€™s fingers continued on their tender exploration.

He took a moment to really consider the feeling of Charlieâ€™s touch on his bare skin â€” how heâ€™d never felt anything quite like it before and how the silent communication offered by such a simple touch was deafeningly loud. Every slow drag of their fingers was the swipe of a paintbrush over canvas, conveying a deep, artistic emotion that words could never capture. Touches before Charlie had been nice , theyâ€™d been exciting and at times even a little thrilling. But when Nick closed his eyes now, allowing himself to become fully immersed in the moment â€” in Charlie â€” he felt passion and creativity in their fingertips dragging over his hip that heâ€™d only ever imagined in his wildest dreams. His mind drifted to times he had longed for this kind of connection, all the moments spent with a partner whose touch sparked more anxiety than desire. Knowing those days were behind him was an emotional anchor that allowed Nick to relish peacefully in this space with Charlie.

When the two of them finally emerged from bed and lackadaisically made their way day the stairs, the furious rumbling of Nickâ€™s stomach had returned in full force. He swiftly scarfed down a day-old muffin while he got the coffee machine up and running for Charlie and dug out the ingredients he needed to make them a pancake breakfast. The whole process felt so familiar, just existing like this in one anotherâ€™s space in this casual and inseparable way that would lead any onlookers to believe theyâ€™d be doing so all their lives.

â€œQuestion,â€ Charlie mused, resting his chin on the palm of his hand as he watched Nick prepare him yet another meal.

â€œAnswer,â€ Nick responded cheekily, never lifting his eyes from the stainless steel measuring cup in his hand as he scraped away a mound of excess flour back into its container to ensure a perfectly flat surface.

â€œWill I ever be required to make food when Iâ€™m in your presence? Itâ€™s okay if I will be, itâ€™s just that Iâ€™m beginning to get a little used to this whole private chef treatment and if youâ€™re not careful I might start expecting it.â€ Charlieâ€™s tone was teasing but Nick could see the faint flush under his skin that gave away his true feelings.

â€œHonestly, unless Iâ€™m deathly ill, probably not. I like to do it.â€ Nick shrugged, and it was true, cooking and baking was his favourite way to show affection to those he cared for. Knowing about Charlieâ€™s relationship with food made it all the more special; Charlie trusted him with a sensitive part of his life gave him an indescribable feeling of honour that only made him more pleased to carry on with the act.

â€œThen who am I to deny you that simple pleasure? Especially when you look so good doing it.â€

Nick flushed, nearly letting the egg in his palm slip between his fingers. The realisation that there was no reason for Charlie to beat around the bush with their flirting any longer got his skin buzzing. The wall between them had been beat down the night before and now nothing at all stood in the way of them shamelessly flirting in the comfort of Charlieâ€™s home; there was no space left for guilt or questioning.

â€œYouâ€™re so easy to fluster,â€ Charlie teased, chuckling as they sipped from their steaming mug of coffee.

â€œI mean, can you blame me?â€ Nick sputtered, dropping a dollop of butter into the heated frying pan and swirling it around. The sputtering sizzle of the melted oils sounded reminiscent of the tingling taking place under Nickâ€™s skin. He glanced over his shoulder, feeling his cheeks heat up under Charlieâ€™s amused gaze.

â€œAnd whatever do you mean by that?â€ Charlie smirked, setting down their mug of coffee and approaching Nick. They waited until he had poured the first round of pancake batter into the pan to spin Nick around with their hands on his hips.

â€œI mean, well,â€ Nick sputtered, motioning vaguely toward Charlie with his free hand. â€œJustâ€¦ look at you, youâ€™re-â€ Nick cut himself off, gingerly shaking his head in disbelief and unable to find the right words to express the extremely potent effect Charlie constantly had on him.

â€œIâ€™mâ€¦ what?â€ Charlie dug, looking up at Nick through his thick eyelashes, batting them slowly above his challenging stare.

It was a brilliant question, in all honesty. What was Charlie? Nick didnâ€™t have the words, there really wasnâ€™t any verbal way to elucidate the effect of Charlieâ€™s presence on Nick. So â€” because he could do so now â€” he showed him instead.

With his hands on Charlieâ€™s waist, Nick walked them back until they knocked into the kitchen island, wetting his lips with a swipe of his tongue before seizing their mouth in a bruising kiss. It was urgent and fast and hungry as Nick was fueled by everything he didnâ€™t know how to profess. Charlie returned the feverous kiss with firm and insistent lips, demanding and giving in equal parts as Nick. Soon enough, Nick craved to be closer, to somehow manoeuvre himself even further into Charlieâ€™s space despite the fact that a slip of paper wouldnâ€™t fit between them right now. In a swift motion, Nick hoisted Charlie by the waist and set them down on the marble countertop, stepping into the newfound space and feeling Charlieâ€™s legs curl around him. They fell into the newness together like theyâ€™d discovered the garden of Eden, pure and untouched â€” a paradise of sensation that was unravelling before their eyes with every new taction. Nick kissed Charlie like heâ€™d never get a chance to voyage these grounds again, let Charlie kiss him like he was the first flower theyâ€™d ever seen come into bloom and the last one theyâ€™d ever have the chance to pick.

Nick commanded control with his body, pulling Charlie against him as though the counter beneath them didnâ€™t exist to hold them up. His strong arms enveloped Charlie, drawing them closer and creating an unbreakable connection. There was no mistaking though that Charlie was in governing the kiss itself. With their hand anchored in Nickâ€™s copper hair, they dictated the angle and the pressure, the pace and the depth of each kiss; Nick was powerless to do anything but go where Charlie took him. He let himself be taken from in a way he had never been allotted the freedom to enjoy with other partners. â€œMy bad.â€ Charlie smiled innocently. He slipped off the counter top and ran a hand through his tousled, black hair. He was a picture of innocence right then, and Nick marvelled at the way he was able to appear so casual after a kiss that had altered Nickâ€™s own brain chemistry.

â€œCan I help at all?â€ Charlie queried.

They were lying on the couch together after Nick found success in his second round of pancakes, stomachs full from the breakfast and warm from the proximity of their bodies. The longing for Charlie to be as close as possible at all times consumed Nick, a thirsting, insatiable hunger that gnawed at the boundary of his every thought. When Charlie returned a few minutes later, the two of them sat facing one another on the couch, knees bumping together while they idly chatted about anything and everything that came to mind. â€œIâ€“â€ Nick started, biting his tongue again. â€œI donâ€™t knowâ€¦â€

He really didnâ€™t. Nickâ€™s thoughts were tangled in knots of unease.

We both obviously developed feelings quite quickly, and while thatâ€™s natural and there is nothing wrong with that, I think weâ€™d be remiss to ignore what each of us are going through right now â€” you, in particular.â€

Nick felt his heart drop for the second time, though not as dramatically as the first. He tried finding solace in Charlieâ€™s admission of feelings, in his promise that this was set to be a positive talk, but the newness in Charlieâ€™s openness was stronger than Nickâ€™s mind and he was once again left feeling on the brink of sinking into the deep end all alone.
